Class PlayerClient

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.View.ClientModel.PlayerClient
public class PlayerClient extends Object
Represents a player client in the game, managing the player's state and dynamic command completion. This class acts as a bridge between the game state logic (PlayerStateClient) and output mechanisms (Out and GuiOut). It allows interaction with the player's current state and provides support for dynamic command completion.

      public PlayerClient()

  • Method Details

    • showGame

      public void showGame(Out out)
      Displays the current game state to the specified output.
      Parameters:
      out - the output mechanism to which the game state will be displayed

    • showGame

      public void showGame(GuiOut out)
      Displays the game state using the provided graphical user interface output object. This method delegates the responsibility of rendering the current game state to the `state` object, which utilizes the given `GuiOut` instance for managing the graphical scenes associated with the game.
      Parameters:
      out - the GuiOut object responsible for managing and displaying graphical scenes.

    • setPlayerState

      public void setPlayerState(PlayerStateClient playerState)
      Sets the current state of the player in the game. This method assigns a new state to the player by replacing the existing state with the specified playerState. The state controls the behavior and actions of the player within the game.
      Parameters:
      playerState - the new state to assign to the player. It must be an instance of a subclass of PlayerStateClient, defining the specific behavior and commands available in the player's current context.

    • getPlayerState

      public PlayerStateClient getPlayerState()
      Retrieves the current state of the player associated with the PlayerClient instance. The state represents the player's context and behavior within the game, and it is managed by an instance of the PlayerStateClient or one of its concrete subclasses.
      Returns:
      an instance of PlayerStateClient representing the player's current state. The returned state may correspond to different game phases or actions available to the player, as implemented by specific subclasses of PlayerStateClient.

    • setCompleter

      public void setCompleter(DynamicCompleter completer)
      Sets the dynamic command completer for the player client. This completer is responsible for dynamically modifying the available commands based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      completer - the dynamic command completer to be associated with the player client

    • getCompleter

      public DynamicCompleter getCompleter()
      Retrieves the DynamicCompleter associated with the player client. The DynamicCompleter is responsible for handling dynamic command completions based on the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      the DynamicCompleter instance associated with this PlayerClient
